alert.note: Alert for Columbia; Richmond (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 31 at 11:15AM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Columbia, north central Richmond, western Fairfield, northwestern Lancaster, Newberry, central Edgefield, western Lexington, northwestern Aiken, Saluda and northwestern Richland Counties through 1145 AM EDT... At 1113 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Carlisle to 6 miles east of Saluda to 6 miles south of Edgefield. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. ...Boaters on Lake Murray Should Seek Safe Harbor... HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... North Augusta, Lexington, Irmo, Newberry, Batesburg-Leesville, Martinez, VC Summer Nuclear Station, Belvedere, Edgefield, Saluda, Johnston, Lesslie, Whitmire, Prosperity, Ridge Spring, Edgefield County Airport, Monticello, Dreher Island State Park, Village Plaza Shopping Center and Augusta National Golf Club. This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 in Georgia between mile markers 195 and 201. Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 0 and 52. Interstate 26 between mile markers 65 and 99. Interstate 520 in Georgia near mile marker 1. Interstate 520 in South Carolina between mile markers 22 and 23. Interstate 77 near mile marker 56. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for development of a very brief, weak tornado. Be prepared to take immediate action if a tornado is sighted or a Tornado Warning is issued.
